review_blob:
Dark Christmas ale with a hint of caramel and cloves. Dark thin head that didnt last. Leaves a slightly sweet, spicy, aftertaste in the mouth.
A pleasant enough drink but I wouldnt go out of my way to find it in the shops !

330ml bottle bought in Carrefour in Brugge to drink at home.
Pours well. Pale straw in colour with a creamy head which lasts well.
Initially tastes quite hoppy but that soon leaves you with a slightly bitter and soapy lemon after taste that I dont find unpleasant !

0.33 litre bottle at home.

Pale amber brew with a lively. frothy. head. 
A pleasant. light brew that belies its alcohol content. Leaves a slight bitter aftertaste in the mouth.

Overall an enjoyable brew but not one to be drunk to excess !

Bought in Carrefour in Brugge to try at home.
Pale yellow in colour. Slightly cloudy with a hint of sourness. Taste very reminiscent of the British confectionary Sherbet Dab !
